Hello,

concerning the .log-file - nothing can be easier, absolutely nothing comes to log for this exception.

Concerning plug-ins - yes, all is installed. Initially BIRT was successfully running, then, after some updates of Eclipse with update manager, it ceased to run (even designer). Then, after uninstalling(by means of "Manage configuration" dialog) old (disabled) versions of all plug-ins designer is available again, but attempt to view a report results in exception, shown in nice window inside report viewer.

BTW, it seems that there is a nice mess with BIRT update site and, in general, in relationship between BIRT and Eclipse update manager. I have done recently a fresh installation of Eclipse (3.2.1, from eclipse-SDK-3.2.1-win32.zip) and then install all plug-ins that I need with update manager. There were some pecularities:

1. BIRT 2.2 (not 2.1) was proposed to install, while on BIRT pages, including download one 2.1 is still named as production version and available for download.

2. Lowagie iText 1.3 was installed, while BIRT installation guide states that for 2.2 iText 1.4.6 is required (while installed version works nicely).

3. When selected in install plugin dialog, BIRT complains that it needs this or that plugin, but "Select required" button does nothing.

4. Complaints about required plugins (in above-mentioned dialog) are sometimes 
misleading as they sometimes mention plug-ins that are already selected for installation, and then disappears when some unmentioned plug-in is selected.

Regards, 
Oleksandr
